content: What's the difference between is_global and is_known_global? When would I want to use one over the other?
is_global should pretty much always be used unless you're inside of predicates/generics_of
https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/constants.html#generic-arguments-of-anonymous-constants talks a bit about this but the documentation definitely needs some work here

or even just a revert because the change to type flags is pretty annoying and doesn't even improve anything for stable users.
Though I still have to figure out a different solution for the underlying issue in that case

is_global can cause query cycles inside of these queries as it relies on the predicates of the parent of unevaluated constants) while is_known_global returns false if the type contains an unevaluated constants with unknown substs, even if these are actually empty
